About Me

Masters of Data Science candidate at the University of Virginia. Interested in exploring data through code; extracting a signal from the noise. I’m passionate about creating an interdisciplinary impact with machine learning and artificial intelligence in the fields of neuroscience and autonomous systems.

I am currently working on a capstone project to develop a specialized LSTM network that models after the scale-invariant patterns of the brain’s time cells and quantify its effects on accuracy for EEG data. The goal is to improve the prediction accuracy of current BCI (Brain-Computer Interface) technology on EEG data by implementing neural features as artificial agents.

Experience

  • Jun 2020 - Sept 2020

    special projects group: ai/ml intern

    developed backend infrastructure for scalable and maintainable data set generation using prestoSQL, apache spark, and kubeflow

  • Aug 2019 - May 2020

    computer science teacher's assistant

    assisted in teaching undergraduate classes of java and algorithms by holding weekly office hours and lab sections

  • Aug 2018 - May 2019

    lead student data scientist

    developed, tested, and integrated growth data models to aid in local charlottesville businesses

  • Jun 2018 - Aug 2018

    technical consultant intern

    corresponded with clients at CMS for data analysis requests on healthcare insurance information

  • Jan 2017 - Dec 2017

    undergraduate researcher

    collected and visualized data to analyze patterns in the predatory behavior of Myxococcus Xanthus
